page.title: 19Trade
page.content: The villages are served by post office stores, one in Plyford, one in Great Bealings (slide). These shops sstock a range of products covering general household needs but choice is limited. They are a lifeline to the non-car owner but prices are higher than in towns. Slogan about such stores is 'Use it or lose it'. The majority of shopping is done in Ipswich or Woodbridge or further afield, one reason for the high car ownership in the area. A mobile shop with groceries and bread visits the villages regularly, also a fish-seller from Lowes estoft parks at certain places and set times once a week. Ipswich co-operative Society's butchery van tours the area once a week, a boon to the housebound. The milkman calls most days and sells a small range of groceries.
